NATIONAL INTEGRATED MATERNAL AND PERINATAL CARE GUIDELINES FOR SOUTH AFRICA 
75 
Chapter 9: INDUCTION OF LABOUR
• Induc
tion of labour is the process of artificially initiating labour with the aim of a vaginal delivery.
• The most frequent indications for induction of labour at district level are post term pregnancy (>41 weeks certain
gestation), hypertensive disorders and pre-labour rupture of membranes.
• Only induce labour in a hospital with 24-hour emergency oper
